text: So I may have accidentally deleted a page from Content Staging entirelyâ€¦ Is there any way to bring it back?
The main content template calls the header partial (in this example) and injects its contents here -> `{% block modules %}{% endblock %}` then passes it back to the main content template.

You can multi layer these depending on the complexity of your templates and how much flexibility you need.

The great thing is that it adheres to the DRY principle fantastically and you can even add modules to partials so you can update content too.
Ooooo. Fancy new tool to play with. Thanks for the info on this.
I believe as of the latest chrome release, it is no longer behind a flag so you are just in time
i know there is a restore deleted pages api but not sure if it works on content staging: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/pages/post_pages_page_id_restore_deleted>

I have added lazy loading to a page via the new method. It looks like everything is working well. Only issue I see is that now in the page editor the image looks like it is broken. I could see that being an issue with the rest of the team. Is there a way around that? Do I need to have a backup src?
By new method, you mean `loading="lazy"` attribute on the image?
Yes
